Summary SOFTWARE DEVELOPER 
Research, Health/Disease Modeling and Policy Decisions 
 
Python and MATLAB Expert 
Software System Modeling 
Code Optimization and Analysis 
 
An innovative, highly-motivated, and quick-to-learn person looking for challenging software modeling opportunities to make real world decisions. 
 
CORE PROFESSIONAL STRENGTHS 
▪Software development & integration 
▪Configuration management and software architecture 
▪Large data set analysis 
▪Reliable & responsible 
▪Large-scale system modeling 
▪Robust software testing and quality assurance built into design 
▪Outstanding meeting deadlines & giving presentations 
 
PYTHON/MATLAB OVERVIEW 
▪Built entire Python health policy application from ground-up. Profuse usage of numpy and matplotlib, 100% code coverage testing with doctest and unittest, auto-documentation with Sphinx/numpydoc and compatible with both Python v2.7 and v3.4+. 
▪Daily user of MATLAB for 14+ years, completely proficient, expert user. 
▪Advanced MATLAB user for analyzing large, high-rate data sets, profiling code speed, optimizing run-time, auto-compiling MATLAB to C, generating GUIs and writing code to auto-generate run-time scripts. 
 
ON-GOING TECHNICAL ACTIVITIES 
▪2015-current, Used Python to develop from scratch a large, multi-disease microsimulation for evaluating the effectiveness of different health policies on lowering the global burden of disease. 
▪2013-current, Using version 3.X of Python, plus relevant scientific libraries as open source alternatives to MATLAB for numeric simulations and analysis.

Zircon Geochronology of the Warner Range Conglomerate unit, Northeastern California. Advisor: Anne Egger.  
 
The Warner Range lies between the unextended Modoc Plateau to the west and the first normal fault in the Basin and Range to the east. Makes range an excellent location to study the evolution of Andean-style convergent setting to Basin and Range extension. As an intern in the sponsorship department, I was able to participate in many varied and worthwhile experiences. My duties ranged from doing online research to networking with existing and potential clients. My research consisted of looking up brand and company profiles, and uncovering what kinds of sponsorships they had done in the past. My work allowed others in the department to gain a better understanding of each individual company and what they might be willing to contribute in a potential partnership.  
I was involved in a variety of client services. I helped plan and organize a sponsorship trip to Cabo San Lucas, Mexico. My responsibilities included coordinating with the airline all the travel information, security, and catering requirements for the trip. Once we arrived, I assisted all the clients so that they knew what activities were going on and made sure they had an enjoyable time. I also helped organize events around UFC fights. My duties included inviting guests, keeping track of RSVP’s, coordinating with the event site, and making sure that all our guests knew where to go and what activities were available. 
Another important duty of mine was to prepare License Agreements for some of our sponsors so that they could use UFC images and footage. I worked directly with our sponsors, and our legal team to make sure that everything was documented correctly. The experience I had with UFC exposed me to a lot of different aspects of the sport industry, and boosted my confidence. Summary I absolutely love sports, shopping for pretty much anything, reading motivational literature (Drive :)), and running outdoors -- well, trotting outdoors LOL... anything to get a bit of fresh air! 
 
Although my professional experience is limited when eliminating softball, I pride myself on being an extremely hard worker, a quick learner, and always having a “can-do” attitude. I am goal-oriented, as is any other Capricorns, and I love to take on new challenges. I do not mind working individually as I like to test my intellect, but I do have a knack for effective communication and cannot deny enjoying being a “go-to” person in team settings.  
 
Overall, I am a “go-getter”, reliable, and I have plenty of great things to bring to the table!
